p: Trees of B. serrata (syn. B. thurifera Colebr. and B. glabra Roxb.) grow in the central and northern parts of India and in Pakistan [ 19]. The geographical delineation by the Arabian Sea isolates B. serrata from other Boswellia species [ 1]. Frankincense from B. serrata represents probably the best investigated Boswellia oleogum resin and it has been used in Ayurvedic medicine for centuries [ 3, 7, 15, 43].
